newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Bank Austria takes seats on CA supervisory board.
newsitem.headline: Bank Austria takes seats on CA supervisory board.

text.p: Bank Austria took final control of Creditanstalt on Friday when the latter's shareholders voted three of Bank Austria's executive board members onto Creditanstalt's supervisory board.
Bank Austria chief executive Gerhard Randa and board members Karl Samstag and Friedrich Kadrnoska were voted on to the non-executive supervisory board with more than 99 percent of votes.
Creditanstalt's new 21-member supervisory board was expected to elect its president later on Friday, widely tipped to be Randa.

Bank Austria bought the Austrian government's 69.45 percent voting stake in Creditanstalt in January for 17.2 billion schillings in cash, closing the book on Europe's longest running privatisation saga. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 53112 254
